#summary How to edit and compile Tamarin and mod-actionscript using Eclipse CDT

= Introduction =

You can very well compile Tamarin without any IDE, but when it comes to edit the code, you should consider using one that provides code completion. Here are the settings for Eclipse CDT


= Details =

install Eclipse + CDT
install mercurial
install zlib1g-dev

 * create "make c++ project"

 * copy tamarin-central inside and add it as source folder

 * create obj-debug dir

 * run configuration script:
{{{
$ cd obj-debug
$ ../tamarin-central/configure --enable-shell --enable-debugger
}}}

CDT Project Settings
  - Build dir: ${workspace_loc:/tamarin/obj-debug}

Hit the hammer icon in the toolbar to build
